author: Kallol Bhattacherjee
text:
A senior government official told The Hindu that the focus on terrorism during the proposed dialogue between the Foreign Secretaries of India and Pakistan would be in line with India’s sharper focus on global terrorism.

“Pakistan has claimed that based on actionable intelligence provided by India following the Pathankot terror strike, it has taken some steps against terrorist group Jaish-e-Mohammed and some individuals. The first round of dialogue between the Foreign Secretaries will provide us an opportunity to evaluate Pakistan’s anti-terror commitment,” said the official.

“There will be no dilution of the agenda or de-linking of any issue from the previously decided agenda of the Comprehensive Bilateral Dialogue,” said the official.
title: A chance to assess Pak.’s commitment: official
